# NEHotspotAuthenticationProvider

**Protocol**

A protocol that defines methods that your extension adopts to start and stop the extension, and to handle commands to authenticate with the hotspot network.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol NEHotspotAuthenticationProvider : AppExtension
```

## Overview

Conform to this protocol in your hotspot helper app extension to handle the hotspot commands [doc://com.apple.networkextension/documentation/NetworkExtension/NEHotspotHelperCommandType/authenticate], [doc://com.apple.networkextension/documentation/NetworkExtension/NEHotspotHelperCommandType/maintain], [doc://com.apple.networkextension/documentation/NetworkExtension/NEHotspotHelperCommandType/presentUI], and [doc://com.apple.networkextension/documentation/NetworkExtension/NEHotspotHelperCommandType/logoff].

## Managing provider life cycle

- **start()**: Tells the extension to start the authentication provider, in response to a request from the framework.
- **stop(reason:)**: Tells the exension to stop the authentication provider, in response to a request from the framework.
- **NEProviderStopReason**: Reasons why the provider extension was stopped.

## Sending commands to the provider

- **handleCommand(_:)**: Handles a given hotspot command, in response to a request from the framework.
- **NEHotspotHelperCommand**: A command for the hotspot helper to handle.

## Hotspot helper extension

- **NEHotspotManager**: A class that you use to enable or disable the hotspot evaluation and authentication provider extensions.
- **NEHotspotEvaluationProvider**: A protocol that defines methods and properties your extension implements to handle evaluate and filter scan list commands.
- **NEHotspotEvaluationProviderConfiguration**: A class that defines configuration options for use in NetworkExtension evaluation providers.
- **NEHotspotAuthenticationProviderConfiguration**: A class that defines configuration options for use in NetworkExtension authentication providers.

## Inherits From

- AppExtension
